definitions: A major Australian financial services group.
Lachlan Macquarie, a British Army officer and colonial administrator who served as the Governor of New South Wales.
A prominent Australian university located in Sydney.
An island in the Southern Ocean, part of Tasmania, Australia.
examples: Macquarie University is known for its research.
Lachlan Macquarie is often called the Father of Australia.
The research station is on Macquarie Island.
